column4: i'm having some issues getting sound working with an audigy 4 card... no sound at all.  there was sound on the live cd.  i've done the due diligence and googled until i can't google anymore... tried all the tricks i found with no luck... ideas?
what happens when you type alsamixer in a terminal?
i've unmuted all the channels
volume's all up
unchecked the "use digital output" switch or whatever it was
did you try turning up surround? my laptop wouldn't get any sound until I turned surround on
turned up everything
it seems to be specific to the audigy cards from what i've seen... but so far, none of the solutions seem to work
did it stop working after the install, or after the upgrades?
i don't remember... i think it worked after the install, but not after upgrades
i did try going back one kernel rev
if you know what is the audigy4 module is you can try replacing the current one with it
the current with the old one that worked
?  I believe it is the emu10k something or other
yeah, emu10k1
the emu10k1 module (which is correct for that card) is loaded, onboard sound is disabled also in case that was interfering...
did you try playing with analog/digital output mute button
yes i did
what do you get when you type lspci -v | grep Creative ?
05:06.0 Multimedia audio controller: Creative Labs SB0400 Audigy2 Value Subsystem: Creative Labs Unknown device 1021
the card appears to be identified correctly (exactly as it was under gentoo on the same machine)
well, i'm booting back to gentoo... this has already taken too much time
thanks for the help, but i give up. shouldn't have to go through all this pain for something so simple, and my gentoo works perfectly.
